p: From this analytical perspective, post-development proposals from the “Global North,” such as deep ecology, degrowth, and ecofeminism (Beling 2019; Kothari et al. 2019), seem to converge with the Epistemologies of the South (Santos 2007). Therefore, some of the results from the industrialization process and technological development (such as information and communication technologies) can contribute forward to the emergence of plural transition horizons, converging on complementary relations in a synthesis between “organic and synthetic knowledge”7 (Santos 2015).
